meanings.definition: Serving no practical purpose or result; ineffective or futile.
meanings.sent1: The broken clock on the wall was otiose, unable to tell the time.
meanings.sent2: The otiose attempt to fix the leaky faucet only made it worse.
meanings.sent3: The otiose efforts to teach a fish to climb a tree were met with amusement.
meanings.sent4: Her otiose promises were like whispers in the wind, easily forgotten.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned building stood as a monument to otiose urban planning.

meanings.sent1: The cat lay otiose in the sun, enjoying a lazy afternoon.
meanings.sent2: After finishing his chores, he felt otiose and decided to take a nap.
meanings.sent3: The otiose sloth lounged in the tree, watching the world go by.
meanings.sent4: Her otiose behavior at work earned her a reputation for laziness.
meanings.sent5: The otiose clouds drifted lazily across the sky, in no hurry to move.
